description: Show off your grill lines with this warm weather take on your favorite food! Pizza dough is grilled and slathered with a rich and zesty sauce enhanced by a splash of cream (and vodka if you like). Toppings? Heaps of charred red onion, zucchini, and organically sourced bell pepper are perfect seasonal additions. Add tangy goat cheese and melty mozzarella and turn this dinner into a life-affirming event.
name: Grilled Vodka Sauce Pizza with Goat Cheese and Grilled Vegetables
subtitle: with Goat Cheese and Grilled Vegetables
title: Grilled Vodka Sauce Pizza
cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking.

No grill? No worries! Preheat oven to 450Â°F. Place vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet and roast for about 15 minutes. Assemble the pizza and bake for 15-20 minutes. 

If you have trouble rolling the pizza dough, let it temper at room temperature for 5 minutes before continuing.

If you're not using vodka, skip the stove! Stir together pizza sauce and heavy cream in a medium bowl; it'll warm up during grilling.
equipment: grill or grill pan with lid

steps.title: Prepare Ingredients
steps.description: Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat (see Recipe Tip). Peel onion and thinly slice as much as desired. Rinse remaining produce. Cut zucchini crosswise into .25-inch slices. Halve bell pepper lengthwise, discarding seeds, and thinly slice into strips. Rinse basil and tear leaves into bite-size pieces, discarding stems.

steps.title: Grill Vegetables
steps.description: In a large bowl, toss onion, zucchini, and bell pepper with 1 tablespoon olive oil, .5 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Add vegetables to grill in a single layer and cook until lightly charred, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate and set aside.

steps.title: Roll Out Dough
steps.description: While vegetables grill, dab 1 teaspoon olive oil onto a clean dry surface. Divide pizza dough into 2 equal pieces and place onto oiled surface. Using a rolling pin or the heels of your hands, roll and stretch each piece to about .25-inch thickness (see Recipe Tip).

steps.title: Season Sauce
steps.description: Place pizza sauce in a small pot over medium heat and cook until warmed through, about 3 minutes (see Recipe Tip). Stir in heavy cream and vodka, if using. Cook until flavors are melded, about 3 minutes more. Remove pan from heat.

steps.title: Grill Pizza
steps.description: Wipe grill from vegetables clean. Rub 2 tablespoons olive oil over both sides of pizza dough pieces, dividing evenly. When grill is just smoking, add pizza dough in a single layer and cook, working in batches if necessary, until charred on both sides, about 4 minutes per side, then remove from grill.

steps.title: Plate Pizza
steps.description: Spread sauce on top of each pizza, leaving a .5-inch border. Add cheese mix and grilled vegetables, sprinkling evenly. Return pizza to grill, cover with lid or aluminum foil, and cook until cheese is melted, 5-10 minutes. Garnish with basil. Cut pizza into slices and commence the feast. Refrigerate any leftovers in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
